title: Ireland’s Next Leader Has a Tough Job: Hold Back Sinn Fein
description: The sudden exit of Prime Minister Leo Varadkar leaves Ireland at a crossroads. Unaffordable housing, inequality and political pressures linked to immigration give the nationalist Sinn Fein party an opportunity to take power for the first time in 2025, or sooner.

title: Warming Ties: Australia Briefing
description: Good morning, it’s Georgie here in Sydney. Here’s what you need to know this morning...Today’s must-reads:• Australia prepares for a   visit by China’s Premier• RBA committee standoff• NZ has scope to cut rates in 2024: IMF

title: US Investigates Loan to Schools in Kenya After Sexual Abuse Reports
description: The US government’s lender for development projects is investigating its oversight of a loan it made for schools in Kenya after allegations emerged of sexual abuse.

title: Top Biden Official Visits Kyiv and Vows Ukraine Aid Will Pass
description: National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan made a surprise visit to Kyiv and vowed that the US House of Representatives would approve a $60 billion aid package for Ukraine, saying there was no need to come up with other plans to get the country the help it needs.

title: Fed’s Message on Interest Rate Cuts: Wait Just a While Longer
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, economics enterprise reporter Rich Miller assesses the latest indicators from the Federal Reserve. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: Sri Lanka to Start Restructuring Talks With Investors Next Week
description: Global investors and Sri Lanka officials expect to start negotiations aimed at restructuring $12 billion in defaulted global bonds next week, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Biden Hails $20 Billion for Intel, Says Trump Lost Jobs to China
description: President Joe Biden said his $20 billion award to Intel Corp. demonstrated his investments in US industries that had withered under Donald Trump’s tenure, touting a flurry of government spending he hopes will help him defeat his Republican rival in a general-election rematch.

title: Venezuela Orders Arrest of Machado’s Campaign Manager, Top Aides
description: Venezuela’s government ordered the arrest of nine top aides to opposition leader María Corina Machado on Wednesday for their alleged involvement in a plot to destabilize Nicolás Maduro’s government.

title: Republicans Call for Raising Retirement Age in Clash With Biden
description: The largest caucus of House Republicans called for an increase in the Social Security retirement age Wednesday, setting up a clash with President Joe Biden over spending on popular entitlement programs.

title: Argentina’s Oilfield Billionaire Has ‘Lot of Hope’ for Milei
description: Paolo Rocca, billionaire chief of oil-pipe maker Tenaris SA, said expectations are high that Argentina’s President Javier Milei can turbo-charge development of the country’s shale deposits.

title: Fed’s Powell Says It’ll Soon Be Appropriate to Slow Pace of QT
description: The Federal Reserve will maintain the pace at which it’s reducing bond holdings, even as officials said it will be appropriate to slow the pace of the unwind fairly soon.

title: Bonds Rally After Fed Keeps 2024 Median Rate Forecast at 3 Cuts
description: Treasury yields declined after Federal Reserve policy makers’ revised interest-rate forecasts continued to anticipate three quarter-point cuts by year-end, while projecting higher rates in future years than they saw in December.

title: Sunak Expresses Anger With Rebel Tories Over Plots Against Him
description: Rishi Sunak told members of his Conservative Party that rebel MPs were making him “angry,” people familiar with the matter said, in a sign that the prime minister believed he needed to fight back against plots to oust him.

title: China on Track to Be Ready for Taiwan Invasion by 2027, US Says
description: China is building its military and nuclear arsenal on a scale not seen since World War II and all signs suggest it’s sticking to ambitions to be ready to invade Taiwan by 2027, a top US admiral testified.

title: Polish Lawmakers Accuse Central Bank Chief of Bond-Buying Faults
description: Lawmakers in Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk’s party will introduce a lengthy string of accusations against the country’s central bank chief as part of a motion that ultimately seeks to oust Governor Adam Glapinski.

title: French Navy Seizes Cocaine in Gulf of Guinea Worth $755 Million
description: The French Navy has seized 10.7 metric tons of cocaine in the Gulf of Guinea, the biggest interception of the illegal trade off the coast of West Africa.

title: TikTok Draws Fresh Scrutiny From Key US Senate Democrats
description: Senate Commerce Chair Maria Cantwell said she’s considering holding a public hearing on TikTok and social media following a classified briefing Wednesday with US intelligence officials.

title: Salinas Companies Owe $3.8 Billion, Mexican Tax Official Says
description: Four companies controlled by Ricardo Salinas Pliego owe the government 63 billion pesos ($3.8 billion), the head of the country’s tax authority said on Wednesday, amid a deepening dispute between President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador and the billionaire.

title: Brazil’s Second-Biggest Bank Says Lula Has Been Seeking Its Help
description: Brazil’s president asked the country’s second-largest bank to join his government’s efforts to help boost credit and economic growth, Banco do Brasil SA Chief Executive Officer Tarciana Medeiros said.

title: Ally of Slovak Premier Fico Poised for Presidency, Poll Shows
description: An ally of Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico is likely to win a presidential election as the European Union nation starts voting this weekend, a poll released Wednesday showed.

title: Texas Deportation Law Gets Skeptical Reception From Key Judge
description: A key judge on a panel of the 5th US Circuit Court of Appeals appeared skeptical of a Texas law that would allow the state to arrest and remove people who enter the country illegally.

title: Attacks on Russia Border Regions Bring Home Costs of Putin’s War
description: Deadly attacks on Russian regions bordering Ukraine are increasingly bringing home the costs of Vladimir Putin’s invasion. That doesn’t yet mean people are turning on the Russian president over the war.

title: Trump Publicly Hints at Support for 15-Week Abortion Ban
description: Donald Trump suggested in a radio interview he would support a 15-week abortion ban with exceptions, the first time he has publicly offered specifics on an issue that’s stymied Republicans.

title: Marjorie Taylor Greene Wants Georgia to Disbar DA Fani Willis
description: Representative Marjorie Taylor Greene asked for the disbarment of Fulton County District Attorney Fani Willis over her romantic relationship with a top prosecutor in her Georgia election interference case against Donald Trump.

title: Biden’s Newest Rule on Auto Emissions Set to Boost Electric Car Sales
description: The Biden administration moved Wednesday to throttle pollution from the nation’s cars and light trucks, imposing tailpipe emission limits so stringent they will compel automakers to rapidly boost sales of battery electric and plug-in hybrid models.

title: Prabowo Officially Declared as Indonesia’s Next President
description: Prabowo Subianto has been officially declared the winner of Indonesia’s presidential election by a wide margin, paving way for him to take the helm at Southeast Asia’s largest economy later this year.

title: Montenegro Sticks to Handing Do Kwon to Korea, in a Snub to US
description: Montenegro’s Appellate Court confirmed a ruling that South Korea’s extradition demand for disgraced crypto mogul Do Kwon has priority over a similar demand by US where prosecutors also want to try him for the $40 billion collapse of the TerraUSD stable coin in 2022.

title: Trump Judge Allows Appeal of His Ruling on Fani Willis Romance
description: Donald Trump and seven co-defendants won permission to appeal a Georgia judge’s ruling that Fulton County District Attorney Fani Willis can remain on the state election-interference case despite her romance with a top prosecutor.

title: Speaker Johnson Touts GOP Wins on Migrant Detention in Funding Deal
description: Speaker Mike Johnson on Wednesday promoted a funding boost for migrant detention and cuts to diversity and climate programs to try to sell his restive Republican conference on a $1 trillion spending deal, according to a person familiar with the discussions.

title: United Steelworkers Endorse Biden for President in 2024 Boost
description: The United Steelworkers union formally endorsed President Joe Biden, a move that bolsters his campaign in crucial industrial swing states, and comes a week after he opposed the proposed sale of United States Steel Corp.

title: Bank Bosses Criticized by MPs for Replacing Branches With Bathrooms
description: British customers are “perplexed” by substitute bank branches in unusual locations including a garden center and even a former public toilet, according to lawmakers.

title: Blinken Set to Visit Israel as US Looks to Shape Rafah Campaign
description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken announced he will visit Israel later this week, as the Biden administration looks to blunt the impact on civilians if Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu goes ahead with an invasion of Rafah.

title: South African Minister Plans Sweeping Change to End Water Crisis
description: South African Water Minister Senzo Mchunu plans to overhaul the national water industry and strip municipalities of responsibility for its provision, as interruptions to supply anger citizens two months ahead of national elections.

title: Baltimore Wants to Sell Hundreds of Vacant Homes for $1 Each
description: Baltimore officials are deciding whether to sell boarded-up houses for the nominal price of $1 to draw homeowners to spruce up neighborhoods that have been plagued by crime and disrepair.

title: Ukrainian Premier Sees US Aid Coming as Early as This Month
description: Ukraine’s prime minister said blocked US funding could arrive as soon as this month – and that the scope of recruiting fresh troops for the front line may be fewer than the half-million initially backed by the military.

title: Goldman’s Hatzius Says Inflation Headed Lower, June Cut Likely
description: US inflation is still on a downward path despite the higher prints in recent months, said Goldman Sachs Group Inc.’s Chief Economist Jan Hatzius, supporting the bank’s expectation for an interest-rate cut in June.

title: Reeves' Economic Vision: Labour Questioned On Spending and Rishi Sunak Pressured Over Rwanda
description: Get caught up on the day’s political news

title: India’s Probe Finds Rogue Officials Involved in US Murder Plot
description: India’s investigation into US claims of an attempted murder of a Sikh leader in New York found that rogue operatives not authorized by the government had been involved in the plot, according to senior officials familiar with the matter.

title: Militants Stage Attack Near China-Operated Pakistan Port Complex
description: Unidentified militants have staged an attack near Pakistan’s Gwadar port complex in the country’s southwest Balochistan region, according to a local police official.

title: Angola Government Workers Strike for Better Pay as Costs Rise
description: Angolan government workers began a three-day strike to press for higher wages and lower taxes to make up for rising living costs in Africa’s second-biggest oil producer.

title: Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar Steps Down Unexpectedly
description: Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar stepped down as premier and as leader of the Fine Gael party.

title: Dutch State Is Ignoring Schiphol Noise Concerns, Court Rules
description: The Dutch government is acting “unlawfully” by not taking into account local residents’ concerns over noise around Amsterdam’s Schiphol airport.

title: Philippines Says Chinese Navy Ship Seen Circling Amid Sea Spat
description: At least 30 Chinese vessels, including a People’s Liberation Army Navy ship, were spotted around areas in the South China Sea that the Philippines claims as part of its territory, according to its military.

title: London Underground Drivers to Strike Again in April and May
description: Train drivers on the London Underground will strike again in April and May as part of an ongoing dispute over working conditions.

title: US Vote Pitches Bidenomics Against Celebrity
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.

title: Vietnam’s President Quits in Latest Sign of Leadership Turmoil
description: Vietnam President Vo Van Thuong offered his resignation and it was accepted by the nation’s Communist Party, according to a statement provided to local media.

title: A Bellwether Pennsylvania Factory Town Is Wary of Bidenomics
description: Northampton County in Pennsylvania has been shaped by its industrial past. Yet even here the president’s bid to spur manufacturing is not without its critics.

title: Ex-F1 Driver Mazepin Wins Court Fight Over EU’s Russia Sanctions
description: Former Russian Formula 1 driver Nikita Mazepin, son of one of Vladimir Putin’s business allies, won his fight against European Union sanctions, in a ruling that could give hope to other well-connected families punished by the EU after the invasion of Ukraine.

title: Russia's Crude Flows Fall Back as Major Ports Hit by Disruptions
description: Shipments drop from the largest Baltic and Pacific export terminals

title: Germany’s Birth Rate Plunges as War, Climate and Covid Deter Parents
description: Germany’s birth rate fell to the lowest level in more than a decade last year, adding to concerns about how a shrinking workforce may dent the country’s economic prospects.

title: Netherlands Floats Ending AT1s After Credit Suisse Upheaval
description: The Dutch government has floated the idea of abolishing a risky type of bank bonds after the asset class was temporarily thrown into deep turmoil last year.

title: Texas Investment Advisers, Lawyers to Raise $6 Million for Biden
description: President Joe Biden is slated to raise millions of dollars from some of the biggest Democratic donors in Texas this week as he looks to expand his cash lead over rival Donald Trump.

title: EU Offers Plan to Use Profits of Frozen Russian Cash for Ukraine
description: The European Union’s top diplomat offered a plan Wednesday to use proceeds from sanctioned Russian central bank assets to help fund Ukraine’s military needs.

title: EU Is Losing Its Economic Competitiveness, German Executives Say
description: A majority of German executives think the European Union has lost attractiveness as a place for doing business, according to a new survey by the DIHK industry lobby.

title: EIB Can Fund Defense and Keep Top ESG Score, Says Sustainalytics
Years After 231 Million % Inflation, Zimbabwe Eyes Gold Standard
description: Zimbabwe, the poster child of hyperinflation, is allowing a free fall in its currency that it’s no longer keen to defend and is instead working on a new exchange rate potentially backed by gold.

title: Long Wait to Join the EU Means Fewer Investors for North Macedonia, Central Banker Says
description: North Macedonia’s central bank governor said the lack of progress in talks to join the European Union is driving away investors.

title: EU Agrees to Extend Trade Benefits to Ukraine as Farmers Protest
description: The European Union got closer to extending trade support for Ukraine for another year, while creating stronger safeguards to prevent imports of certain products getting too high.

title: North Korea Tests Solid-Fuel Engine for Hypersonic Missile
description: North Korea tested a solid-fuel engine for its new hypersonic intermediate-range ballistic missile, state media said Wednesday, a move likely aimed at bolstering the country’s strike capabilities against US bases in Asia.

title: Thai Court Seeks More Documents in Move Forward Dissolution Plea
description: Thailand’s Constitutional Court called for more documents in a petition seeking to disband the nation’s largest opposition party that was previously found guilty of breaching the country’s charter over efforts to amend the royal defamation law.

title: South Korean Tanker Capsizes Off Southwestern Japan
description: TOKYO (AP) — A South Korean tanker capsized off an island in southwestern Japan early Wednesday, and the coast guard said it had rescued four crew members and was still searching for seven who were missing.

title: Ukraine’s Drone Strikes on Russian Oil Refineries Mark New Phase in War
description: Ukraine’s fight against Russia’s invasion has entered a new phase, pitting homegrown drone technology against a 2,000 kilometer (1,200 mile) swathe of largely Soviet-era oil facilities.

title: Suu Kyi’s Family Mansion Auction Fails as No Bidder Showed Up
description: Myanmar junta’s attempt to sell an iconic family mansion belonging to ousted leader Aung San Suu Kyi flopped as a court-ordered auction on Wednesday failed to attract any bidders.

title: Netanyahu Will Speak to Republican Senators After Schumer Rebuke
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu will speak with Senate Republicans via video on Wednesday, less than a week after the chamber’s top Democrat, Chuck Schumer, called for elections to replace him.

title: Hong Kong Faces Battle to Shore Up Its Role as Financial Hub After Security Law
description: Hong Kong just passed its local security law at record speed, placating Beijing and antagonizing Western governments. It now has the challenging task of bolstering the city’s position as an international finance center.

title: Chinese Premier Li Qiang on Track for Australia Visit, Foreign Minister Penny Wong Says
description: Australia is preparing for a visit by Chinese Premier Li Qiang, the country’s second-most senior leader, in a sign that improving relations between Canberra and Beijing weren’t upended by recent setbacks.

title: RBA Overhaul Hits Snag as Opposition Plans to Move Amendment
description: Australia’s government and the opposition are at loggerheads over the makeup of the Reserve Bank’s new monetary policy committee, a showdown that threatens to derail legislation needed to overhaul the institution.

title: Indonesia VAT Hike in Question as Lawmakers Show Emerging Rifts
description: Indonesia’s planned increase to the value-added tax could be in question after several lawmakers called for a delay, showing how rifts may be emerging in parliament as the largest ruling party is set to fall to opposition.

title: The Indian Opposition Leaders Challenging Modi in Elections
description: India’s opposition alliance, launched with much fanfare last year, is heading into next month’s election on the backfoot, struggling to mount a successful challenge against Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

title: Rulli Wins GOP Primary for Ohio Seat Vacated by Johnson
description: State Sen. Michael Rulli won the special GOP primary to complete former Rep. Bill Johnson’s term, AP reports.

title: Taylor Wins Republican Primary for US House Seat in Ohio
description: Businessman David Taylor won the Republican primary in the race for Ohio’s 2nd Congressional District, AP reports.

title: Iswaran Returned to Singapore and Surrendered Passport: CNA
description: Singapore’s former transport minister S. Iswaran has returned to the country and surrendered his passport to the authorities, CNA reported, citing a spokesperson from the Attorney-General’s Chambers.

title: Merrin Wins Republican Primary for US House Seat in Ohio
description: State Rep. Derek Merrin won the Republican primary in the race for Ohio’s 9th Congressional District, AP reports.

title: Davis Wins Democratic Primary for US House Seat in Illinois
description: Incumbent Danny Davis won the Democratic primary for the US House seat in Illinois’s 7th Congressional District, AP reports.

title: Coughlin Wins Republican Primary for US House in Ohio
description: Former state senator Kevin Coughlin won the Republican primary in the race for Ohio’s 13th Congressional District, AP reports.

title: Trump-Backed Moreno Wins GOP US Senate Primary in Ohio
description: Bernie Moreno, an Ohio businessman, won the state’s Republican US Senate primary, according to the Associated Press, prevailing over the traditionalist GOP establishment with Donald Trump’s backing and a populist appeal.

title: UK’s Plans to House Asylum Seekers Will Cost More Than Hotels
description: Massive cost overruns mean UK government plans to house asylum seekers on former military bases and barges will cost even more than allowing them to remain in hotels, according to the official spending watchdog.
